intro: Galium hierosolymitanum, commonly known as Jerusalem crowfoot, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, creeping stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
